Package ca.yapper.yapperapp.OrganizerFragments.ParticipantListFragments

Class SelectedListFragment

java.lang.Object
androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
ca.yapper.yapperapp.OrganizerFragments.ParticipantListFragments.SelectedListFragment
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner
public class SelectedListFragment extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
SelectedListFragment displays the list of users selected to participate in a specific event. This fragment allows for re-selection by drawing users from the waiting list as needed. The list is retrieved from Firestore and displayed in a RecyclerView.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment

  • Method Details

    • onCreateView

      @Nullable public android.view.View onCreateView(@NonNull android.view.LayoutInflater inflater, @Nullable android.view.ViewGroup container, @Nullable android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
      Inflates the fragment layout, initializes Firestore, RecyclerView, adapter, and UI components, and loads the selected list for the specified event. Sets up a redraw button for re-selection.
      Overrides:
      onCreateView in class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      Parameters:
      inflater - LayoutInflater used to inflate the fragment layout.
      container - The parent view that this fragment's UI is attached to.
      savedInstanceState - Previous state data, if any.
      Returns:
      The root view of the fragment.

    • loadEventDetails

      private void loadEventDetails()
      Loads the capacity of the event from Firestore, setting the maximum number of selected participants.

    • refreshList

      public void refreshList()
      Refreshes the selected list by reloading data from Firestore and updating the RecyclerView.

    • finalizeRefreshList

      private void finalizeRefreshList()
      This function updates the UI of the list, and check various aspects of the selected list.

    • dumpPendingApplicant

      private void dumpPendingApplicant()
      This function dumps pending applicants by moving users from the selected list to the cancelled list, as well as sending a cancelled notification and updating the users invitation status.

    • onAllPendingChecksCompleted

      private void onAllPendingChecksCompleted(List<User> usersToRemove)
      This function check if the given list is empty, and if not, then it removes all the users in it from the selected list and updates UI elements accordingly.
      Parameters:
      usersToRemove - a list of users to remove

    • movePendingUsersToCancelledList

      private void movePendingUsersToCancelledList(List<User> pendingUsers)
      This function moves pending users to the cancelled list
      Parameters:
      pendingUsers - a list of users who still haven't accepted their invitations

    • moveUserBetweenUserSubcollections

      private void moveUserBetweenUserSubcollections(String userId, String eventId, String subcollectionFrom, String subcollectionTo)
      This function moves a given user between two of an events subcollections
      Parameters:
      userId - The id for the user, created from the device id.
      eventId - The id for the event
      subcollectionFrom - The subcollection the user is coming from
      subcollectionTo - The subcollection the user is going to move to

      Parameters:

      private void showEmptyState(boolean isEmpty)
      This function shows the empty state layout for a recycler view
      Parameters:
      isEmpty - indicator of an empty state

    • loadSelectedList

      private void loadSelectedList()
      Loads the selected list from the "selectedList" subcollection of the event document in Firestore. Updates the RecyclerView adapter with the retrieved users.

    • redrawApplicant

      private void redrawApplicant()
      Allows re-selection of participants by randomly choosing from the waiting list and moving users to the selected list, based on the event's capacity. Updates the UI with newly selected participants.

    • drawFromWaitingList

      private void drawFromWaitingList()
      This function draws random users from the waiting list. It will draw enough to fill the remaining spots in the selected list.

    • moveUserToSelectedList

      private void moveUserToSelectedList(User user)
      Moves a user from the waiting list to the selected list in Firestore.
      Parameters:
      user - The user to be moved. // @param onComplete Runnable executed once the move is complete.

    • sendCancelledNotif

      private void sendCancelledNotif(String userDeviceId)
      This function sends cancelled notifications to a given user
      Parameters:
      userDeviceId - The device ID of the user.

      private void moveUserToCancelledList(String userDeviceId)
      This function moves a user from the selected list to the cancelled list of an event.
      Parameters:
      userDeviceId - The device ID of the user.

    • refreshAllFragments

      private void refreshAllFragments()
      Refreshes all fragments displaying participant lists for the event, ensuring that UI updates are reflected across all views.

      This function sends notifications to users who were not selected from the draw.
